questions.question_text:
What mechanism is used to ensure adjacent devices can redirect their Ethernet traffic to the Session Border Controller that takes over, when a Session Border
Controllers fails over?

choices.A: A phy-interface element must be configured for each interface used for High Availability (HA) heartbeats, but not for signaling and/or media.
choices.D: A unique phy-interface configuration element is created for all signaling/media interfaces.
choices.B: After configuring a phy-interface configuration element for signaling and/or media, a reboot of the Session Border Controller is required.
choices.C: A phy-interface configuration element must be configured for each interface used.
choices.E: A phy-interface configuration element for signaling and/or media has the operation-type parameter set to control.

questions.question_text: Which configuration step is correct for a phy-interface configuration element used for signaling and/or media?

choices.E: Another steering-pool configuration element with same ip-address and realm-id but with different start-port and end-port parameters values
choices.B: The ip-address parameter of the steering-pool has the same value as the address parameter of a sip-port configuration element.
choices.C: The realm-id parameter value of the steering-pool refers to a realm-config element that does not exist in the configuration.
choices.D: Another steering-pool configuration element with same ip-address, realm-id, start-port, and end-port parameters values already exists in the configuration.
choices.A: The realm-id parameter value of the steering-pool refers to a realm-config element that already exists in the configuration.

discussion.content: Correct Anser is D: also ports must be the same (I tried :) )

questions.question_text:
You are configuring steering pools. After executing the done command, you get this error message: error 409 saving configuration SteeringPool.
Identify the cause of the error.
What should you do to enable physical interface redundancy?

choices.E: Run the superuser command enable phy-redundancy.
choices.C: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and set the link-redundancy-state parameter to enabled.
choices.A: Navigate to the system-config configuration element and set the phy-redundancy parameter to enabled.
choices.B: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and set the phy-redundancy parameter to enabled.
choices.D: Navigate to the system-config configuration element and set the link-redundancy-state parameter to enabled.

discussion.content:
Link redundancy is configured by setting the link-redundancy-state parameter to enabled in system-config.
Correct Answer: D

choices.E: Navigate to the sip-interface configuration element and set the realm-id parameter to the realm name.
choices.B: Navigate to the account-config configuration element and set the realm-id parameter to the realm name.
choices.C: Navigate to the network-interface configuration element and set the sip-interface-id parameter to the realm name.
choices.D: Navigate to the steering-pool configuration element and set the realm-id parameter to the realm name.
choices.A: Navigate to the iwf-config configuration element and set the media-interface-id parameter to the realm name.

questions.question_text:
The Session Border Controller ACLI is structured in a way that separates configuration of layers 3,4, and 5. This allows the system administrator to link each configuration together as needed for signaling and media routing purposes.
Which two options are valid to link signaling and media interfaces to a realm? (Choose two.)
